page.title: 15Changes For Snailbeach.
page.content: At a recent public meeting, engineers councillors, and landscape architects presented ideas for the development of the Snailbeach mining area. There were three strategies:{Strategy {One;}a minor conservation project, making buildings safe, restoring old engine sheds, limited access to mines,landscaping spoil heaps and marking footpaths.{Strategy Two; provisions for tourists,car parking, full restoration of buildings, bridle paths on old railway routes, screening and landscaping, limited access to the mines{Strategy Three;}full development as a national tourist attraction like Ironbridge, with working machinery including the light railway, guided tours , information centre, toilets, cafe, shop and pub. Many were anxious about the effect on the village and some didn't want any changes at all.
